Cuda::Size< 2 > FlowLib::getOptimalMemSize ( Cuda::Size< 2 >  size  ) 

Calculates the optimal memory size. This is important for the efficiency of the algorithm! Make sure to use this size to create the input device memory as else the memory has to be copied

Parameters:
size size of input image
Returns:
optimal size for memory

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool FlowLib::getWarpedImage ( Cuda::DeviceMemory< float, 2 > *  w_image  ) 

Returns warped image (currently first image is warped to second one.

Todo:

Parameters:
[out] w_image warped image

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool FlowLib::getWarpedImage ( Cuda::DeviceMemoryPitched< float, 2 > **  w_image  ) 

Returns warped image. Currently second image is warped back to the second one. The memory allocation is done internally but no memory management is done afterwards. The ownership of the memory is passed to the caller of this fcn.

Todo:
: define warp direction
Parameters:
[out] w_image warped image

Here is the call graph for this function:

Cuda::DeviceMemoryPitched< float, 2 > *  flow_v

bool FlowLib::run (  )  [private]

Helper functions to run the correct calculations for the selected model.

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool FlowLib::runAlgorithm ( const int  iterations = 0  ) 

Sets flag if images are copied or only the pointers are switched to the new images.

Parameters:
copy If FALSE the images are copied (default behaviour) and if not the pointers are switched. Runs optical flow calculations with the specified amount of iterations. If the number of iterations is set to 0, the algorithm will run for the last selected number of iterations.
iterations number of iterations to calculate
Returns:
TRUE if everything was ok and FALSE if not.

Here is the call graph for this function:

int  width,
int  height,
size_t  pitch,
bool  on_device = true 
)

Alternative input method.

Parameters:
buffer Float buffer containing image data.
width Image width.
height Image height.
stride Image pitch. (Number of _bytes_ in a row)
on_device Flag if buffer resides on the device (TRUE) or on the host (FALSE).

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool FlowLib::setInput ( Cuda::DeviceMemory< float, 2 > *  image  ) 

Sets a new input image to calculate flow on this consecutive frame(s). If no image was set previously the Library does nothing, returns FALSE and waits for another image. If enough images are available to start the algorithm the function returns TRUE.

Parameters:
image Input image.
do_not_copy_images Flag that forces just a pointer switch and no copy operation for input images. This flag has to be set only once!
Returns:
TRUE if enough images are set an flow can be calculated and FALSE if not.

bool FlowLib::setInput ( Cuda::DeviceMemory< float, 2 > *  first,
Cuda::DeviceMemory< float, 2 > *  second 
)

Sets two images as initial input to calculate 2-frame-flow

Parameters:
first First input image.
second Second input image.
Returns:
TRUE if enough images are set an flow can be calculated and FALSE if not.

void FlowLib::setStructureTextureDecomposition ( CudaFlowLib::FilterMethod_t  filter,
const float &  weight,
const float &  smoothing 
)

Generic set method for Structure-Texture Decomposition.

Parameters:
[in] filter Filter method that is used for str.-tex. decomp. (please use all uppercase letters!!)
[in] weight Defines weighting between structure and texture component.
[in] smoothing amount of smoothing for str.-tex. decomposition.
Returns:
TRUE if state was changed. Means if activate switches the filters state.

Here is the call graph for this function:

const float &  smoothing

Returns:

std::map<std::string, CudaFlowLib::Model> FlowLib::abrv_model_map_ [private]

Maps model abbrevations from a string to the Model enum.

CudaFlowLib::BaseData* FlowLib::data_ [private]

Current data structure.

FlowParameters FlowLib::flow_params_ [private]

Color gradient for creating colored flow field. Parameters to initialize flow calculation. This is not used if a data structure is available! Then the parameters are set directly.

Cuda::DeviceMemoryLinear<float,1>* FlowLib::gradient_ [private]
